intro: Thladiantha lijiangensis var. latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled thladiantha, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, with broad, fleshy sepals. It is often found in mountainous regions with a humid climate, growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
